Description: FreshPoint Inc., a Houston, Texas-based food distribution company and wholly owned subsidiary of Sysco Corp., agreed to pay $4.2 million to resolve allegations that it overcharged the Department of Defense for fresh fruit and vegetables purchased under 15 separate contracts.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/freshpoint-inc-pay-42-million-overbilling-department-defense-produce

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 424480: Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Merchant Wholesalers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Sysco Corp. and its California operating companies agreed to pay $19.4 million in settlement of allegations by the California Food, Drug and Medical Device Task Force (consisting of 10 California District Attorneys) that it violated California's Health and Safety laws by transporting and storing potentially hazardous foods above a safe temperature.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2014/jul/sysco_corporation_settlement#more
